roles: director of Asia/Pacific global finance operations
corporate director of Asia Pacific global finance operations
supporting_quotes: He graduated from the Institute of Business Administration and later joined the corporate staff of the CitiBank Pakistan in 1969.
Initially, Aziz joined the corporate branch of Citibank Pakistan as its credit officer in 1969.
Aziz as the director of Asia/Pacific global finance operations, CitiBank
Investment Banking (CIB), Corporate Planning Officer (CPO), Chief Financial Officer of Citicorp and managing director of Citibank Singapore.

At Citibank, Aziz served as the corporate director of Asia Pacific global finance operations and had been notable for financing and managing funds on behalf of Citibank and other financial corporations in global stock markets.
events.notes: Multiple roles at Citibank merged into one event due to overlapping time periods and same organization.

supporting_quotes: Shaukat Aziz had been a president of Citi Private Bank in New York before returning to Pakistan in 1999.
events.notes: Role as president of Citi Private Bank before returning to Pakistan.

supporting_quotes: Previously, he served as the finance minister of Pakistan from 6 November 1999 to 15 November 2007.
Aziz reportedly returned with Musharraf in November 1999 and took charge of the Finance ministry as its Finance Minister.

As Minister of Finance Aziz also headed the Economic Coordination Committee of the Cabinet, the Cabinet Committee on Investment, the executive committee of the National Economic Council, and the Cabinet Committee on Privatization.
events.notes: Role as Finance Minister of Pakistan with additional committee responsibilities.

roles: Member of the National Assembly of Pakistan
supporting_quotes: Member of the National Assembly of Pakistan
events.notes: Role as a member of the National Assembly of Pakistan with no specific time markers provided.

supporting_quotes: Shaukat Aziz (born 6 March 1949) is a Pakistani-born British former banker who served as the 15th prime minister of Pakistan from 28 August 2004 to 15 November 2007.

Following the resignation of Mir Zafarullah Khan Jamali on 26 June 2004, Hussain nominated Aziz for the office of prime minister and was also a top choice for the candidacy of prime ministerial post by Musharraf.
events.notes: Role as Prime Minister of Pakistan with extensive responsibilities and activities.

supporting_quotes: Aziz co-chaired the Secretary-General's High Level Panel on the United Nations System-wide Coherence in the areas of development, humanitarian assistance and the environment.
events.notes: Role as co-chair of the United Nations System-wide Coherence panel with no specific time markers provided.

supporting_quotes: In 2008, Aziz participated in the Global Creative Leadership Summit, organised by the Louise Blouin Foundation. As a delegate, he delivered a keynote speech for the panel entitled 'Economic Crisis, Economics of Change: Credit, Commodities, and Trade.'
events.notes: Role as a delegate at the Global Creative Leadership Summit organized by the Louise Blouin Foundation.

deduplication_log.reasoning: Multiple roles at Citibank merged into one event due to overlapping time periods and same organization.
